intro: Euodia nishimurae, commonly known as Nishimura's euodia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rutaceae. It is native to the island of Okinawa in Japan, where it grows in moist, shaded forest environments. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and fragrant, white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruits are small, smooth, and turn from green to yellowish when mature. Euodia nishimurae is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
